attributes.action: require MPs and civil servants to be properly educated in the difference between a) e-petitions; b) representative opinion polls; c) evidence based research in to what is actually in the public interest.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
E-petitions provide a welcome opportunity for people to express their opinion, however they only sample a very selective group of people - i.e. those who are politically active and technologically aware. This disregards the views of many others who do not choose to involve themselves in petitions, but whose opinions are equally important.
Opinion polls attempt to take in to account the opinion of the whole population by using representative samples.
However, although the government is obliged to listen to the public, they are also under an obligation to do what is best for the people. Sometimes looking at evidence based research may result in better decisions than listening to what people say that they want.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
